newsitem.title: UK: London coffee futures tumble on fund sell-off.
newsitem.headline: London coffee futures tumble on fund sell-off.

text.p: London's futures for robusta coffee took a tumble on Tuesday on a big fund sell-off, taking the benchmark September contract down by a hefty $100 or 5.8 percent to $1,635 a tonne by mid-morning.

"It's all fund selling and there's no buying around," said one floor trader. The contract slipped through the previous key support at $1,695 and this triggered sell-stops and long liquidation by funds and specs.
Traders said the slide was also exacerbated by origin selling especially from the Far East.
But they were unable to immediately pinpoint specific fundamental reasons behind the sharp falls, which have taken the market to the lowest level since late April.
The winter weather in Brazil's coffee areas remained mild while inventories in the United States were building up again.
Chartwise, traders put the immediate support at the triple bottom of around $1,610, the lows seen on late April.

After a dazzling price rally since early January on nearby supply tightness, the market peaked in late May at around $2,700 level before easing off again. --Jalil Hamid, London newsroom +44 171 542 4985
